body: We're going to need more information to debug this - can you post a stack trace, along with some description of what's in mlruns?
I just want to add that I see the same issue on the same setup.
@jbauer2718 , do you have any more specific stack traces or information about your setup that you can offer?
I fixed the issue; you can't have subdirectories in the metrics folder. I don't know if this is a bug report or a feature request :p
Did you manually add a subdirectory to your metrics? @jbauer2718
I too am experiencing 404 for the metrics-view. In fact, i can't view a single metric.

@ankitmathur-db it may be the subfolders! I didn't manually add them, my metrics are called `train/xy` , `validation/xy`, `test/whatever` to keep it consistent with tensorflow. I have half a year of recorded metrics that i can't view!

it never occured to me that they may be the problem. I thought this was related to #884 , from which i sporadically suffered.

Try copying train/xy to xy. That worked for me. I manually added that
directory afterwards and was able to view the metrics.

On Mon, Aug 12, 2019, 05:48 Leander Kurscheidt <notifications@github.com>
wrote:

> @ankitmathur-db <https://github.com/ankitmathur-db> it may be the
> subfolders! I didn't manually add them, my metrics are called train/xy ,
> validation/xy, test/whatever to keep it consistent with tensorflow. I
> have half a year of recorded metrics that i can't view!
>
> —
> You are receiving this because you were mentioned.
> Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub
> <https://github.com/mlflow/mlflow/issues/1692?email_source=notifications&email_token=AMKHPSY5PBFKYCFKCQIWQM3QEE5XJA5CNFSM4II6SP6KYY3PNVWWK3TUL52HS4DFVREXG43VMVBW63LNMVXHJKTDN5WW2ZLOORPWSZGOD4CFILA#issuecomment-520377388>,
> or mute the thread
> <https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/AMKHPSZLYGC67YS4VQ7PABLQEE5XJANCNFSM4II6SP6A>
> .
>

Using the estimator API TF automatically create a `global_step/sec` summary. The metric shows up correctly in the run page, but the link is incorrect. It has the form `/#/metric/global_step/sec?runs=[...]` and leads to 404. Escaping the `/` with `%2f` (e.g. `#/metric/global_step%2fsec?runs=[...]`) works. There is probably a `encodeURIComponent()` call missing on the front end side.
